trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Central Desktop | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Central Desktop | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Central Desktop with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Central Desktop with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Central Desktop
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Central Desktop

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Central Desktop.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Central Desktop.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Central desktop single sign on enabled subscription / Central desktop tenant
trans-unit.target: A Central desktop single sign on enabled subscription / Central desktop tenant

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Central Desktop
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Central Desktop

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Central Desktop
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Central Desktop

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Central Desktop.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Central Desktop.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Central Desktop, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Central Desktop, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Central Desktop.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Central Desktop.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Central Desktop, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Central Desktop, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Central Desktop</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Central Desktop</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Central Desktop with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Central Desktop with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Central Desktop tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your Central Desktop tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Nase
trans-unit.target: Nase

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Central Desktop application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Central Desktop application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Central Desktop page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Central Desktop page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps, and then click Next:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps, and then click Next:

trans-unit.source: In the Central Desktop Sign In URL textbox, type the URL of your Central Desktop tenant (e.g.: http://contoso.centraldesktop.com).
trans-unit.target: In the Central Desktop Sign In URL textbox, type the URL of your Central Desktop tenant (e.g.: http://contoso.centraldesktop.com).

trans-unit.source: In the Central Desktop Reply URL textbox, type your Central Desktop AssertionConsumerService URL (e.g.: https://contoso.centraldesktop.com/saml2-assertion.php).
trans-unit.target: In the Central Desktop Reply URL textbox, type your Central Desktop AssertionConsumerService URL (e.g.: https://contoso.centraldesktop.com/saml2-assertion.php).

trans-unit.source: You can get the value from the central desktop metadata (e.g.: http://contoso.centraldesktop.com).
trans-unit.target: You can get the value from the central desktop metadata (e.g.: http://contoso.centraldesktop.com).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Central Desktop page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Central Desktop page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Central Desktop tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Central Desktop tenant.

trans-unit.source: Go to Settings, click Advanced, and then click Single Sign On.
trans-unit.target: Go to Settings, click Advanced, and then click Single Sign On.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup - Advanced</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup - Advanced</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Single Sign On Settings page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Single Sign On Settings page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML v2 Single Sign On.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML v2 Single Sign On.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Central Desktop page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the SSO URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Central Desktop page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the SSO URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Central Desktop page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SSO Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Central Desktop page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SSO Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Central Desktop page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the SSO Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Central Desktop page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the SSO Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Message Signature Verification Method section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Message Signature Verification Method section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Message Signature Verification Method</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Message Signature Verification Method</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Certificate.
trans-unit.target: Select Certificate.

trans-unit.source: From the SSO Certificate list, select RSH SHA256.
trans-unit.target: From the SSO Certificate list, select RSH SHA256.

trans-unit.source: Create a text file from the downloaded certificate, copy the content of the text file, and then paste it into the SSO Certificate field.
trans-unit.target: Create a text file from the downloaded certificate, copy the content of the text file, and then paste it into the SSO Certificate field.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Select Display a link to your SAMLv2 login page.
trans-unit.target: Select Display a link to your SAMLv2 login page.

trans-unit.source: Click Update.
trans-unit.target: Click Update.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: For AAD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned to the Central Desktop application.
trans-unit.target: For AAD users to be able to sign in, they must be provisioned to the Central Desktop application.

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to create AAD user accounts in Central Desktop.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to create AAD user accounts in Central Desktop.

trans-unit.source: To provision user accounts to Central Desktop:
trans-unit.target: To provision user accounts to Central Desktop:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Central Desktop tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Central Desktop tenant.

trans-unit.source: Go to People \> Internal Members.
trans-unit.target: Go to People \> Internal Members.

trans-unit.source: Click Add Internal Members.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Internal Members.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Email Address of New Members textbox, type an AAD account you want to provision, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: In the Email Address of New Members textbox, type an AAD account you want to provision, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Email Addresses of New Members</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Email Addresses of New Members</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Internal member(s).
trans-unit.target: Click Add Internal member(s).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Internal Member</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Internal Member</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The users you have added will receive an email that includes a confirmation link they need to click to activate the account.
trans-unit.target: The users you have added will receive an email that includes a confirmation link they need to click to activate the account.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Central Desktop user account creation tools or APIs provided by Central Desktop to provision AAD user accounts
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Central Desktop user account creation tools or APIs provided by Central Desktop to provision AAD user accounts

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Central Desktop, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Central Desktop, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Central Desktop application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Central Desktop application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
